programme.title: This Wild Life
programme.desc: The family's first few weeks running a safari camp in a rugged outpost on northern Kenya's frontier has been a rollercoaster ride, but now the real test begins. The rainy season hits Samburu National Reserve and as a rogue flash flood hits camp, Saba Douglas-Hamilton races to protect the camp and the animals, while an elephant and its calf get into trouble.(n)

programme.title: This Wild Life
programme.desc: Wildlife expert Saba Douglas-Hamilton and the elephant rescue team race to save the life of a recently orphaned calf. The baby elephant is flown to an elephant orphanage in Nairobi, but with a terror threat on the Kenya's East coast, the family's safari camp is also in crisis. Saba must work to save the business and do all she can to protect Samburu's trusting elephants.(n)

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The savannah's mixture of grassy plains and woodlands boast an array of wildlife, ranging from many species of big cat to herds of buffalo, wildebeest and gazelle. The programme explores the way animals and people have shaped these lands.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60 on a Mission
programme.sub-title: Deadly on a Mission: Pole to Pole: Jungle Expedition
programme.desc: As the crew embarks on an expedition deep into the jungles of Guyana, Steve Backshall goes in search of a harpy eagle, but his first find is a feisty two-metre-long snake. Next, the team sets up camp on the banks of a remote river, where Steve discovers an ant with the world's most painful sting and encounters a spider that can reach the size of a dinner plate. Finally, he explores below the water of the rainforest rivers, reeling in a wolf fish with teeth to rival a piranha's and swimming with a creature so deadly that just touching it could stop his heart.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60 on a Mission
programme.sub-title: Deadly on a Mission: Pole to Pole: Best Of
programme.desc: Highlights of the series in which Steve Backshall undertook a global quest from the Arctic Circle to Antarctica, encountering the world's deadliest animals in their natural habitats. Featuring the presenter's encounters with polar bears and leopard seals, his failed attempts to stand up to tornado-force winds and scorching-hot lava flows, and previously unseen footage of his bumps, trips and slips.(n)

programme.title: This Wild Life
programme.desc: The safari camp reopens after the rainy season, but Saba Douglas-Hamilton worst nightmare is turning into reality. She has a houseful of guests on their way, but the cupboards are bare and there's nowhere for them to sleep. Her husband Frank Pope has problems of his own as he attempts to fit a tracking device to a six-ton bull elephant.(n)

programme.title: This Wild Life
programme.desc: Samburu National Reserve's safari camp faces its busiest week yet, as wildlife expert Saba Douglas-Hamilton embarks on a mission to find newborn lion cubs. Meanwhile, her husband Frank Pope races to rescue a lioness in need of help. The pair's troubles are compounded when a power crisis strikes the camp, and one member of the team is rushed to hospital with what is suspected to be malaria.(n)

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The wildlife of the African deserts, where rain may not fall for 10 years at a time. In spite of inhospitable conditions, a multitude of species survives in these arid landscapes, including cartwheeling spiders, camels, squirrels which use their tails as sunshades, and even crocodiles.(n)

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: George Kourounis investigates gravity by experiencing extremes of aviation and space training aboard an Albatross fighter jet. He examines the phenomena of G-force and zero gravity by diving from 30,000 feet and encountering spinning centrifuges producing 6G.(n)

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: George Kourounis sets out to explore the deep sea world by submarine from Grand Cayman Island. Meanwhile, her husband Frank Pope races to rescue a lioness in need of help. The pair's troubles are compounded when a power crisis strikes the camp, and one member of the team is rushed to hospital with what is suspected to be malaria.(n)

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The wildlife of the African deserts, where rain may not fall for 10 years at a time. programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: Fergal Keane narrates a documentary focusing on the abundant wildlife found along the continent's 29,000km coastline. Species exist in habitats as diverse as the icy waters of the Cape and the tropical climes of the Indian Ocean, leading to some bizarre variations in behaviour - seals eat birds and die of heatstroke, crabs climb trees and penguins live in deserts.(n)

programme.title: Gordon Buchanan: Elephant Family & Me
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which Gordon Buchanan encounters a family of African elephants in the wilds of Kenya, and attempts to gain their trust so he can observe them up close in their natural habitat. He enlists the aid of an expert from the David Sheldrick Wildlife Trust to learn about their behaviour as he follows an elephant with a new calf, and discovers what it takes for the youngest of the world's largest land animals to survive in the face of a challenging environment.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60 on a Mission
programme.sub-title: Deadly on a Mission: Pole to Pole: Wild Islands
programme.desc: Steve Backshall and the team continue to island-hop across the Southern Ocean, beginning in the Falkland Islands where they encounter the rockhopper penguin and one of the area's fiercest underwater predators. They then endure four days of sailing through some of the roughest seas on Earth as they travel to the remote Bird Island off South Georgia, where they are met by hundreds of Antarctic fur seals and a wandering albatross.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60 on a Mission
programme.sub-title: Deadly on a Mission: Pole to Pole: Jungle Expedition
programme.desc: As the crew embarks on an expedition deep into the jungles of Guyana, Steve Backshall goes in search of a harpy eagle, but his first find is a feisty two-metre-long snake. Next, the team sets up camp on the banks of a remote river, where Steve discovers an ant with the world's most painful sting and encounters a spider that can reach the size of a dinner plate. Finally, he explores below the water of the rainforest rivers, reeling in a wolf fish with teeth to rival a piranha's and swimming with a creature so deadly that just touching it could stop his heart.(n)

Frank and David set off on a dangerous mission to help the biggest bull elephant in northern Kenya.(n)

programme.title: This Wild Life
programme.desc: The family and the camp team celebrate the end of the tourist season, Samburu-style. Saba watches over the elephant mothers as they are about to give birth, and Frank and David try to safeguard the future of Samburu's wildlife.(n)

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The wildlife of Africa's green belt, an area spanning 5,500km from Uganda in the east to Sierra Leone in the west, which is hotter, brighter and wetter than anywhere else on the continent, allowing plants to flourish. People and animals have learned to exploit this abundance - colobus monkeys have developed specialised bacteria-filled stomachs to neutralise the toxins found in their leafy diet, while the Bakaya and Fang tribes use plant poisons to stun their quarry when hunting.(n)

programme.title: Gordon Buchanan: Elephant Family & Me
programme.desc: The second of two programmes in which Gordon Buchanan encounters a family of African elephants in the wilderness of Kenya, and attempts to gain their trust so he can observe them up close in their natural habitat.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Sun
programme.desc: Using satellite images and the expertise of Britain's leading solar scientists, Kate Humble and Helen Czerski investigate the inner workings of the star and the influence its cycles of activity have on Earth. They reveal the sun is more active now than it has been for a decade, sending out super-heated plasma and waves of radiation, and examine why some experts think longer-term changes in its behaviour may have powerful effects on the world's climate.(n)

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: George Kourounis heads to the Arabian Desert to explore one of the most remote places on earth - the Empty Quarter. The vast, windswept area of trackless sand dunes stands in stark contrast to the glitzy and modern city of Dubai. The presenter sets off from Abu Dhabi on a four-week safari and makes it his mission to see both sides of the Arabian Peninsula.(n)

programme.title: The CNBC Conversation
programme.desc: Putting the spotlight on business and political leaders. He joined Cisco over 20 years ago and was appointed CEO 2015 and Chairman in 2017. We find out what vision Chuck Robbins has for the network hardware company and why he's putting philanthropic efforts at the heart of his management style.(c)

programme.title: The Brave Ones
programme.desc: Business programming.(c)

programme.title: Managing Asia
programme.desc: Business news and analysis concerning Asia, featuring interviews with the region's leading executives and managers.(c)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Catch a Contractor
programme.desc: The team hunts for unreliable contractor Avi, who was hired to fix a burst sewer pipe but left the job unfinished. Rendered physically sick by the ensuing insect infestation, the homeowners require Adam and Skip to track the man down and force him to address the debacle he created.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Mac uncovers a murder on board a commercial flight from New York to Washington DC and sets up a makeshift crime lab to catch the killer. The case takes an unexpected twist with the discovery that the victim, an escaped convict with a history of drug-running, was posing as a federal air marshal to smuggle cash out of the country.(n)

programme.title: Remington Steele
programme.desc: A body is found floating in a vat of wine, jeopardising the owner's business plans - and even more so when the corpse disappears. Starring Pierce Brosnan and Stephanie Zimbalist.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Curtis investigate the murder of a model and discover splashes of blood that obviously did not come from the victim, but suggest the culprit is a relative. With Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The fatal stabbing of a psychologist draws Briscoe and Curtis into a heated divorce case and pits McCoy and Ross against a manipulative attorney who puts results before professional ethics. Award-winning American police drama, starring Jerry Orbach.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A model is electrocuted at a fashion show, and the CSIs quickly determine her death was no accident. Investigating further, they discover the case is connected to a heroin-smuggling ring involving a fashion designer - and a prisoner who once held Horatio's son Kyle hostage. Crime drama, starring David Caruso.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team uncovers faulty bulletproof vests in an abandoned truck filled with stolen USMC merchandise, and attempts to locate the source of the cargo and any vests that could have been sent to military personnel overseas. Crime drama, guest starring Challen Cates, with Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: An answering machine message leads Briscoe and Curtis to reopen an investigation into an arson attack that killed a girl - but the 15-year-old suspect has a powerful ally in his grandfather, an influential force in political spheres. Award-winning police drama, guest starring Robert Vaughn (Hustle) alongside Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The murder of a Middle Eastern man sends Briscoe and Curtis racing to thwart a suspected terrorist plot to bring destruction to New York - and leads them to uncover a domestic conspiracy involving horrific female circumcision. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Mac and the team uncover the lair of serial murderer the `Compass Killer' while investigating how he escaped from the World's Fair site in Queens. Stella learns he is targeting people whom he imagines could have been responsible for his wife's death, and the case becomes a race against time to find out who will be the fourth victim. Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: The body of a 14-year-old boy is discovered in the desert, and although the team initially believes a librarian might be the killer, forensic evidence soon links his death to someone entirely different. Unfortunately the new suspect has the perfect alibi - he has been in prison for more than two years, and his lawyer immediately seizes on developments, claiming her client may have been imprisoned for a crime he did not commit.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the disappearance of photographer Martin Roe, who was due to testify at an army first lieutenant's court-martial after he captured a picture of what appeared to be a soldier killing an unarmed civilian. However, the photograph is leaked, and Roe is later found dead with a needle in his arm.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Director Vance charges DiNozzo with a special assignment to go to France, locate Admiral Kendall's wayward daughter Amanda and bring her home. Arriving in Marseille, Tony immediately heads to the local NCIS office, only to find five dead agents. After eventually tracking down Amanda, the pair embark on a rollercoaster ride to the relative safety of the nearest NCIS office in Spain. Michael Weatherly stars.(n)

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: The DA hires Bull to help convict Hazel Diaz, a drug dealer who murdered a police officer but has avoided jail for years on an insanity defence.(n)

programme.title: Grimm
programme.desc: Following a brutal attack in the woods, Nick and Hank stumble upon a terrifying Wesen disease that may be the inspiration for the modern-day werewolf myth. Meanwhile, Adalind is offered an uneasy alliance that may help her get back what she wants most and Eve's investigation uncovers a surprising revelation. Ann Cusack guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson and Stabler investigate a reported case of child abuse, but are faced with a dilemma when the prime suspect - the victim's stepfather - offers to reveal the identity of a controversial civil rights group's leader in exchange for an amnesty. Guest starring Jim True-Frost (The Wire) and Garret Dillahunt (Terminator: The Sarah Connor Chronicles).(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: The murder of a former drug addict uncovers an insurance racket worth millions of dollars. Initially, a rock singer whose car was used in the killing is the prime suspect, until two femmes fatales come to the fore. Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise and Melina Kanakaredes, with Vanessa Minnillo and Kim Kardashian (who both starred in Disaster Movie) and Pat Monahan (from the band Train).(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: A police officer shoots his ex-partner in a parking lot, leaving the team to determine whether the crime was accidental or premeditated - and possibly racially motivated. However, the case takes another complex turn with the discovery that the dead officer had previously made a complaint against his killer - providing a solid motive for murder. Starring Marg Helgenberger and Laurence Fishburne.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The young daughter of a wealthy family finds her nanny dead, setting in motion an investigation that sheds an unflattering light on the lives of the rich and famous. programme.desc: Religious fanatic Cameron bans rehearsals for a local amateur dramatics production after discovering his daughter has fallen for her stage lover - played by the son of impoverished crofter Duncan. programme.title: MASH
programme.desc: The black market grips the 4077th, where two bottles of Scotch can buy secret surgery. Korean War comedy, starring Alan Alda and Mike Farrell.(n)

programme.title: MASH
programme.desc: When their bus breaks down on the way on the way back from a medical convention, Hawkeye, BJ, Colonel Potter, Frank and Radar find themselves stranded. Korean War comedy, starring Alan Alda and Gary Burghoff.(n)

programme.title: The New Avengers
programme.desc: The crime-busting trio race to find whoever is responsible for hypnotising ordinary members of the public into becoming assassins - especially after discovering that Steed's on the hitlist. Tongue-in-cheek espionage adventure, starring Patrick Macnee, Joanna Lumley and Gareth Hunt.(n)

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Burke tackles a copycat killing inspired by a murder committed 20 years previously when a body wrapped in bin bags is recovered from the Clyde. Enlisting the help of celebrated pathologist Irene Russell, he races to solve the case before more victims die. As events unfold, it becomes clear that the ultimate target may be someone at the heart of the investigation. Alison Peebles guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Kidnapped: The Hannah Anderson Story
programme.desc: True-life crime drama based on the abduction of a 16-year-old girl in August 2013, Hannah Anderson was take following cheerleader practice in a San Diego suburb by a family friend. Her mother and brother's bodies were found later that same day in James DiMaggio's burned-out home. After she was later tracked down, some people pondered whether Hannah was complicit in the killing of her mother and brother. Jessica Amlee and Scott Patterson star.(n)

programme.title: No One Would Tell
programme.desc: A shy teenager thinks all her dreams have come true when the school's star athlete asks her out. However, the relationship soon turns sour as her seemingly perfect boyfriend becomes possessive, controlling and violent. Drama, starring Fred Savage, Candace Cameron Bure, Gregory Alan Williams and Rodney Eastman.(n)

programme.title: MASH
programme.desc: A flurry of devious activity is unleashed in the camp when pay day arrives. Burns buys a pearl necklace for his wife and a string of fakes for Hot Lips, while Trapper gives away his poker jackpot to get Hawkeye out of trouble. Korean War comedy, starring Alan Alda.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A forthcoming county fair brings out a streak of competitiveness in the family. Olivia is surprised to hear her childhood sweetheart, the now wealthy Oscar Cockrell, is to be one of the judges. Peter Donat guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Laura holds Doc Baker responsible for her son's death, causing the rest of the town to reject him.(n)

Drama, starring John Michie.(r)

programme.title: The Hound of the Baskervilles (?)
programme.desc: Sherlock Holmes and Dr Watson set out to protect the last remaining member of the aristocratic Baskerville family, who believes he is being persecuted by a monstrous spectral hound roaming the bleak Devon moors.
